required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Long-Term Infliximab for Psoriasis (P05319)
clinical_study.official_title: Real-World Assessment of Long-Term Infliximab Therapy for Psoriasis

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective Phase 4, open-label, non-randomized, observational, multi-center study of infliximab in participants with plaque-type psoriasis to assess the clinical response in real-world practice of long-term maintenance therapy with infliximab 5 mg/kg body weight in a psoriasis population, prescribed in a regimen in accordance with the product monograph (PM) for Canada, the approved summary sheet of product characteristics (SPC) for countries in the European Union (EU), or per label according to local guidelines for all other participating countries.

detailed_description.textblock: This study will be conducted in two phases: the 50-week treatment period and the 48-week extended treatment period.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With a Psoriasis Area Sensitivity Index (PASI)-75 Response at Week 50
primary_outcome.description: Participant PASI scores were used to measure the severity and extent of psoriasis. Using a scale of 0=none to 4= very severe, each body region (head, trunk, arms, and legs) is rated for redness, thickness and scaling of the largest psoriatic area in that region; these 4 totals (totals ranging from 0 to 16) are then multiplied by the standardized percentage of total body area that each region represents (head = 0.1 of body surface area, trunk = 0.2 of body surface area, arms=0.3 of the body surface area, and legs = 0.4 of body surface area). An assessment is then made of the percentage of the area in that body region that is involved by the psoriatic lesions; this is expressed by a score from 0 (0% involved) to 6 (100% involved) and this score is multiplied by the subtotal of the total body area of that region; the four region scores are then added to produce the total PASI score. PASI-75 response was defined as >=75% improvement in overall PASI score when compared to baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With a PASI-90 Response at Week 50 Among Participants With a PASI-90 Response at Week 14
secondary_outcome.description: Participant PASI scores were used to measure the severity and extent of psoriasis. Using a scale of 0=none to 4= very severe, each body region (head, trunk, arms, and legs) is rated for redness, thickness and scaling of the largest psoriatic area in that region; these 4 totals (totals ranging from 0 to 16) are then multiplied by the standardized percentage of total body area that each region represents (head = 0.1 of body surface area, trunk = 0.2 of body surface area, arms=0.3 of the body surface area, and legs = 0.4 of body surface area). An assessment is then made of the percentage of the area in that body region that is involved by the psoriatic lesions; this is expressed by a score from 0 (0% involved) to 6 (100% involved) and this score is multiplied by the subtotal of the total body area of that region; the four region scores are then added to produce the total PASI score. PASI-90 response was defined as >= 90% improvement when compared to baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Particpants With a PASI-90 or PASI-75 at Week 50 Among Participants With a PASI-75 Response at Week 14
secondary_outcome.description: Using a scale of 0=none to 4= very severe, each body region (head, trunk, arms, and legs) is rated for redness, thickness and scaling of the largest psoriatic area in that region; these 4 totals (totals ranging from 0 to 16) are then multiplied by the standardized percentage of total body area that each region represents (head = 0.1 of body surface area, trunk = 0.2 of body surface area, arms=0.3 of the body surface area, and legs = 0.4 of body surface area). An assessment is then made of the percentage of the area in that body region that is involved by the psoriatic lesions; this is expressed by a score from 0 (0% involved) to 6 (100% involved) and this score is multiplied by the subtotal of the total body area of that region; the four region scores are then added to produce the total PASI score. PASI-90 and PASI-75 response were defined as >=90% improvement and a >=75% improvement, respectively, in overall PASI score when compared to baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With a PASI-90, PASI-75, or PASI-50 Response at Week 50 Among Participants With a PASI-50 Response at Week 14
secondary_outcome.description: Using a scale of 0=none to 4= very severe, each body region (head, trunk, arms, and legs) is rated for redness, thickness and scaling of the largest psoriatic area in that region; these 4 totals (ranging from 0 to 16) are then multiplied by the standardized percentage of total body area that each region represents (head = 0.1 of body surface area, trunk = 0.2 of body surface area, arms=0.3 of the body surface area, and legs = 0.4 of body surface area). An assessment is then made of the percentage of the area in that body region that is involved by the psoriatic lesions; this is expressed by a score from 0 (0% involved) to 6 (100% involved) and this score is multiplied by the subtotal of the total body area of that region; the four region scores are then added to produce the total PASI score. PASI-50, PASI-75, and PASI-90 response were defined as >=50%, >=75%, >=90% improvement in PASI score versus baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With a PASI-90 Response at Week 98 Among Participants With a PASI-90 Response at Week 50 and Who Entered the Extended Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: Participant PSAI scores were used to measure the severity and extent of psoriasis. Using a scale of 0=none to 4=very severe, each body region (head, trunk, arms, and legs) is rate for redness, thickness and scaling of the largest psoriatic area in that region; these 4 totals (ranging from 0 to 16) are then multiplied by the standardized percentage of total body area that each regon represents (head=0.1 of body surface area, trunk=0.2 of body surface area, arms=0.3 of body surface area, legs=0.4 of body surface area). An assessment is then made of the percentage of the area in that body region that is involved by the psoriatic lesions; this is expressed by a score from 0 (0% involved) to 6 (100% involved) and this score is multipled by the subtotal of the body area of that region; the four region scores are then added to produce the total PASI score. PSAI-90 response was defined as >=90% improvement in overall PASI score when compared to baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With a PASI-90, PASI-75, or PASI-50 Response at Week 98 Among Participants With a PASI-50 Response at Week 50 and Who Entered the Extended Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: Using a scale of 0=none to 4= very severe, each body region (head, trunk, arms, and legs) is rated for redness, thickness and scaling of the largest psoriatic area in that region; these 4 totals (ranging from 0 to 16) are then multiplied by the standardized percentage of total body area that each region represents (head = 0.1 of body surface area, trunk = 0.2 of body surface area, arms=0.3 of the body surface area, and legs = 0.4 of body surface area). An assessment is then made of the percentage of the area in that body region that is involved by the psoriatic lesions; this is expressed by a score from 0 (0% involved) to 6 (100% involved) and this score is multiplied by the subtotal of the total body area of that region; the four region scores are then added to produce the total PASI score. PASI-50, PASI-75, and PASI-90 response were defined as >=50%, >=75%, >=90% improvement in PASI score versus baseline, respectively.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Mean PASI Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 14, Week 30, Week 50, Week 62, Week 78, Week 98
secondary_outcome.description: Using a scale of 0=none to 4= very severe, each body region (head, trunk, arms, and legs) is rated for redness, thickness and scaling of the largest psoriatic area in that region; these 4 totals (ranging from 0 to 16) are then multiplied by the standardized percentage of total body area that each region represents (head = 0.1 of body surface area, trunk = 0.2 of body surface area, arms=0.3 of the body surface area, and legs = 0.4 of body surface area). An assessment is then made of the percentage of the area in that body region that is involved by the psoriatic lesions; this is expressed by a score from 0 (0% involved) to 6 (100% involved) and this score is multiplied by the subtotal of the total body area of that region; the four region scores are then added to produce the total PASI score. Decreasing scores are indicative of improvement in overall PASI score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With a PASI-90 or PASI-75 Response at Week 98 Among Participants Who Had a PASI-75 Response at Week 50 and Who Entered the Extended Treatment Phase
secondary_outcome.description: PASI socres were used to measure the severity and extent of psoriasis. Using a scale of 0=nonoe to 4=very severe, each body region (head, trunk, arms, and legs) is rated for redness, thickness, and scaling of the largest psoriatic area in that region; thse 4 totals (ranging from 0 to 16) are then multipled by the standardized percentage of total body area that region represents (head=0.1 of body surface area, trunk=0.2 of body surface area, arms=0.3 of body surface area, and legs=0.4 of body surface area). An assessment is then made of the percentage of area in that body region that is involved by the psoriatic lesions; this is expressed by a score from 0 (0% involved) to 6 (100% involved) and this score is multiplied by the subtotal of the total body area of that region; the four region scores are then added to produce the total PASI score. PASI-90 and PASI-75 response were defined at >=90% and >=75% improvement in overall PASI score when compared to baselne, respectively.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Mean Dermatology Life Quality Index (DLQI)
secondary_outcome.description: The DLQI assesses the impact of psoriasis on the participants's daily life. DLQI total score comprises 6 different aspects that may affect quality of life: symptoms and feelings, daily activities, leisure, work or school performance, personal relationships, and treatment. DLQI total scores range from 0 to 30, with 0 corresponding to the best quality of life and 30 to the worst with 0-1=no effect on the partipant's life, 2-5=small effect on the participant's life, 6-10= moderate effect on the participant's life, 11=20= very large effect on participant's life, and 21-30 = extremely large effect on participant's life.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With A DLQI Score of 0 or 1 in the Extended Treatment Phase
secondary_outcome.description: The DLQI assesses the impact of psoriasis on the participants's daily life. DLQI total score comprises 6 different aspects that may affect quality of life: symptoms and feelings, daily activities, leisure, work or school performance, personal relationships, and treatment. DLQI total scores range from 0 to 30, with 0 corresponding to the best quality of life and 30 to the worst with 0-1=no effect on the partipant's life, 2-5=small effect on the participant's life, 6-10= moderate effect on the participant's life, 11=20= very large effect on participant's life, and 21-30 = extremely large effect on participant's life.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With a PASI-50, PASI-75, PASI-90, or PASI-100 Response at Week 98
secondary_outcome.description: Using a scale of 0=none to 4= very severe, each body region (head, trunk, arms, and legs) is rated for redness, thickness and scaling of the largest psoriatic area in that region; these 4 totals (ranging from 0 to 16) are then multiplied by the standardized percentage of total body area that each region represents (head = 0.1 of body surface area, trunk = 0.2 of body surface area, arms=0.3 of the body surface area, and legs = 0.4 of body surface area). An assessment is then made of the percentage of the area in that body region that is involved by the psoriatic lesions; this is expressed by a score from 0 (0% involved) to 6 (100% involved) and this score is multiplied by the subtotal of the total body area of that region; the four region scores are then added to produce the total PASI score. PASI-50, PASI-75, PASI-90, and PASI-100 response were defined as >=25%, >=50%, >=75%, >=90%, =100% improvement in PASI score versus baseline, respectively.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Achieved a PASI-75 Response at Week 50 by PASI Score at Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Participant PASI scores were used to measure the severity and extent of psoriasis. Using a scale of 0=none to 4= very severe, each body region (head, trunk, arms, and legs) is rated for redness, thickness and scaling of the largest psoriatic area in that region; these 4 totals (totals ranging from 0 to 16) are then multiplied by the standardized percentage of total body area that each region represents (head = 0.1 of body surface area, trunk = 0.2 of body surface area, arms=0.3 of the body surface area, and legs = 0.4 of body surface area). PASI-75 response was defined as >=75% improvement in overall PASI score when compared to baseline..

intervention.description: Infliximab administered intravenously at a dose of 5 mg/kg body weight at Weeks 0, 2, 6 and then every 8 weeks (Weeks 14, 22, 30, 38, and 46 for the Treatment Period and Week 54, 62, 70, 78, 86, and 94 for the Extended Treatment Period) as per the product monograph (PM; Canada), summary of product characteristics (SPC; European Union), or local labeling (for all other countries).

study_pop.textblock: Participants with plaque-type psoriasis in which the treating physician has selected for treatment with infliximab, in accordance with local clinical practices, will be advised about this trial. It is highly recommended that 30% of the participants enrolled be naïve to previous biologic therapy. For example, if a site recruits 10 participants, 3 out of these 10 participants should be naïve to previous biologic therapy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participant must have a diagnosis of plaque-type psoriasis
- Participant's physician must have decided, with the subject's consent, to start treatment with infliximab
- Participant must demonstrate willingness to participate in the study and agree with the procedures of the study by signing the written informed consent
- For inclusion into the extended treatment period, participant must have completed 50 weeks of infliximab treatment in the treatment period
- For inclusion into the extended treatment period, participant must be continuing treatment with intravenous infliximab
- For inclusion into the extended treatment period, participant must have an improvement in their PASI score of greater than or equal to 25% at the time of entry into to the extended treatment period
Exclusion Criteria:
For the Treatment Period
- Given the non-interventional nature of the study, no specific exclusion criteria will be applied to a participant so long as the participant is eligible for the trial (Inclusion Criteria). The treating physician is expected, as in normal clinical practice, to follow the PM (Canada), the approved SPC (EU), or local labeling (for all other participating countries) regarding contraindications and precautions
For the Extended Treatment Period
- Given the non-interventional nature of the study, no specific exclusion criteria will be applied to a participant so long as the participant is receiving infliximab treatment in accordance with the PM (Canada), the approved SPC (EU), or local labeling (for all other participating countries) regarding contraindications, precautions, dosing and frequency of administration

results_reference.citation: Shear NH, Hartmann M, Toledo-Bahena M, Katsambas A, Connors L, Chang Q, Yao R, Nograles K, Popmihajlov Z; REALITY investigators. Long-term efficacy and safety of infliximab maintenance therapy in patients with plaque-type psoriasis in real-world practice. Br J Dermatol. 2014 Sep;171(3):631-41. doi: 10.1111/bjd.13004. Epub 2014 Aug 13.

group.title: Infliximab 5 mg/kg
group.description: Infliximab administered intravenously at a dose of 5 mg/kg body weight at Weeks 0, 2, 6 and then every 8 weeks (Weeks 14, 22, 30, 38, and 46 for the Treatment Period and Week 54, 62, 70, 78, 86, and 94 for the Extended Treatment Period) as per the product monograph (PM; Canada), summary of product characteristics (SPC; European Union), or local labeling (for all other countries).

participants_list.participants: One of the 660 participants did not receive study treatment.
Clinical responders during the treatment period could enter the extended treatment period.

group.title: Infliximab 5 mg/kg
group.description: Infliximab administered intravenously at a dose of 5 mg/kg body weight at Weeks 0, 2, 6 and then every 8 weeks (Weeks 14, 22, 30, 38, and 46 for the Treatment Period and Week 54, 62, 70, 78, 86, and 94 for the Extended Treatment Period) as per the product monograph (PM; Canada), summary of product characteristics (SPC; European Union), or local labeling (for all other countries).

outcome.title: Number of Participants With a Psoriasis Area Sensitivity Index (PASI)-75 Response at Week 50
outcome.description: Participant PASI scores were used to measure the severity and extent of psoriasis. Using a scale of 0=none to 4= very severe, each body region (head, trunk, arms, and legs) is rated for redness, thickness and scaling of the largest psoriatic area in that region; these 4 totals (totals ranging from 0 to 16) are then multiplied by the standardized percentage of total body area that each region represents (head = 0.1 of body surface area, trunk = 0.2 of body surface area, arms=0.3 of the body surface area, and legs = 0.4 of body surface area). PASI-75 response was defined as >=75% improvement in overall PASI score when compared to baseline.
outcome.population: The Efficacy Population includes all participants with a baseline PASI score within 14 days of the time of the first infusion and at least one post-baseline PASI score.

group.description: Infliximab administered intravenously at a dose of 5 mg/kg body weight at Weeks 0, 2, 6 and then every 8 weeks (Weeks 14, 22, 30, 38, and 46 for the Treatment Period and Week 54, 62, 70, 78, 86, and 94 for the Extended Treatment Period) as per the product monograph (PM; Canada), summary of product characteristics (SPC; European Union), or local labeling (for all other countries).

measure.title: Number of Participants With a PASI-90, PASI-75, or PASI-50 Response at Week 50 Among Participants With a PASI-50 Response at Week 14
measure.description: Using a scale of 0=none to 4= very severe, each body region (head, trunk, arms, and legs) is rated for redness, thickness and scaling of the largest psoriatic area in that region; these 4 totals (ranging from 0 to 16) are then multiplied by the standardized percentage of total body area that each region represents (head = 0.1 of body surface area, trunk = 0.2 of body surface area, arms=0.3 of the body surface area, and legs = 0.4 of body surface area). An assessment is then made of the percentage of the area in that body region that is involved by the psoriatic lesions; this is expressed by a score from 0 (0% involved) to 6 (100% involved) and this score is multiplied by the subtotal of the total body area of that region; the four region scores are then added to produce the total PASI score. PASI-50, PASI-75, and PASI-90 response were defined as >=50%, >=75%, >=90% improvement in PASI score versus baseline.
measure.population: The population includes all participants that achieved a PASI-50 response at treatment Week 14.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With a PASI-90 Response at Week 98 Among Participants With a PASI-90 Response at Week 50 and Who Entered the Extended Treatment Period
outcome.description: Participant PSAI scores were used to measure the severity and extent of psoriasis. Using a scale of 0=none to 4=very severe, each body region (head, trunk, arms, and legs) is rate for redness, thickness and scaling of the largest psoriatic area in that region; these 4 totals (ranging from 0 to 16) are then multiplied by the standardized percentage of total body area that each regon represents (head=0.1 of body surface area, trunk=0.2 of body surface area, arms=0.3 of body surface area, legs=0.4 of body surface area). An assessment is then made of the percentage of the area in that body region that is involved by the psoriatic lesions; this is expressed by a score from 0 (0% involved) to 6 (100% involved) and this score is multipled by the subtotal of the body area of that region; the four region scores are then added to produce the total PASI score. PSAI-90 response was defined as >=90% improvement in overall PASI score when compared to baseline.
outcome.population: The population consists of all participants that achieved PASI-90 response at Week 50 and entered the extended treatment phase.

group.description: Infliximab administered intravenously at a dose of 5 mg/kg body weight at Weeks 0, 2,6, and then every 8 weeks (Weeks 14, 22, 30, 38, and 46 for the Treatment Period and Weeks 54, 62, 70, 78, 86, and 94 for the Extended Treatment Period) as per the product monograph (PM; Canada), summary of product characteristics (SPC; European Union), or local labelling (for all other Countries)

measure.title: Number of Participants With a PASI-90, PASI-75, or PASI-50 Response at Week 98 Among Participants With a PASI-50 Response at Week 50 and Who Entered the Extended Treatment Period
measure.description: Using a scale of 0=none to 4= very severe, each body region (head, trunk, arms, and legs) is rated for redness, thickness and scaling of the largest psoriatic area in that region; these 4 totals (ranging from 0 to 16) are then multiplied by the standardized percentage of total body area that each region represents (head = 0.1 of body surface area, trunk = 0.2 of body surface area, arms=0.3 of the body surface area, and legs = 0.4 of body surface area). measure.population: The population includes all participants that achieved PASI-50 response at Week 50 and entered the extended treatment phase.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Mean PASI Score
outcome.description: Using a scale of 0=none to 4= very severe, each body region (head, trunk, arms, and legs) is rated for redness, thickness and scaling of the largest psoriatic area in that region; these 4 totals (ranging from 0 to 16) are then multiplied by the standardized percentage of total body area that each region represents (head = 0.1 of body surface area, trunk = 0.2 of body surface area, arms=0.3 of the body surface area, and legs = 0.4 of body surface area). An assessment is then made of the percentage of the area in that body region that is involved by the psoriatic lesions; this is expressed by a score from 0 (0% involved) to 6 (100% involved) and this score is multiplied by the subtotal of the total body area of that region; the four region scores are then added to produce the total PASI score. Decreasing scores are indicative of improvement in overall PASI score.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 14, Week 30, Week 50, Week 62, Week 78, Week 98
outcome.population: The population consists of all participants with a baseline PASI score and a subsequent score at Week 14, 30, 50, 62, 78,and 98.

group.title: Infliximab 5 mg/kg
group.description: Infliximab administered intravenously at a dose of 5 mg/kg of body weight at Week 0, 2, 6 and then every 8 weeks (Weeks 14, 22, 30, 38, and 46 for the Treatment Period and Weeks 54, 62, 70, 78, 86, and 94 for the Extended Treatment Period) as per the product monograph (PM; Canada), summary of product characterisitics (SPC; European Union), or local labelling (for all other countries).

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Mean PASI Score
measure.description: Using a scale of 0=none to 4= very severe, each body region (head, trunk, arms, and legs) is rated for redness, thickness and scaling of the largest psoriatic area in that region; these 4 totals (ranging from 0 to 16) are then multiplied by the standardized percentage of total body area that each region represents (head = 0.1 of body surface area, trunk = 0.2 of body surface area, arms=0.3 of the body surface area, and legs = 0.4 of body surface area). An assessment is then made of the percentage of the area in that body region that is involved by the psoriatic lesions; this is expressed by a score from 0 (0% involved) to 6 (100% involved) and this score is multiplied by the subtotal of the total body area of that region; the four region scores are then added to produce the total PASI score. Decreasing scores are indicative of improvement in overall PASI score.
measure.population: The population consists of all participants with a baseline PASI score and a subsequent score at Week 14, 30, 50, 62, 78,and 98.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With a PASI-90 or PASI-75 Response at Week 98 Among Participants Who Had a PASI-75 Response at Week 50 and Who Entered the Extended Treatment Phase
outcome.description: PASI socres were used to measure the severity and extent of psoriasis. Using a scale of 0=nonoe to 4=very severe, each body region (head, trunk, arms, and legs) is rated for redness, thickness, and scaling of the largest psoriatic area in that region; thse 4 totals (ranging from 0 to 16) are then multipled by the standardized percentage of total body area that region represents (head=0.1 of body surface area, trunk=0.2 of body surface area, arms=0.3 of body surface area, and legs=0.4 of body surface area). An assessment is then made of the percentage of area in that body region that is involved by the psoriatic lesions; this is expressed by a score from 0 (0% involved) to 6 (100% involved) and this score is multiplied by the subtotal of the total body area of that region; the four region scores are then added to produce the total PASI score. PASI-90 and PASI-75 response were defined at >=90% and >=75% improvement in overall PASI score when compared to baselne, respectively.
outcome.population: The population consisted of participants who were in the efficacy population of the treatment phase and who entered into the extended treatment phase and had a PASI-75 response at Week 50 with at least one PASI evaluation during the extended treatment phase.

group.title: Infliximab 5 mg/kg
group.description: Infliximab administered intravenously at a dose of 5 mg/kg of body weight at Weeks 0, 2, 6, and then every 8 weeks (Week 14, 22, 30, 38, and 46 for the Treatment Period and Weeks 54, 62, 70, 78, 86, and 94 for the Extended Treatment Period) as per the product monograph (PM; Canada, summary of product characteristics (SPC; European Union), or local labelling (for all other countries).

measure.title: Number of Participants With a PASI-90 or PASI-75 Response at Week 98 Among Participants Who Had a PASI-75 Response at Week 50 and Who Entered the Extended Treatment Phase
measure.description: PASI socres were used to measure the severity and extent of psoriasis. Using a scale of 0=nonoe to 4=very severe, each body region (head, trunk, arms, and legs) is rated for redness, thickness, and scaling of the largest psoriatic area in that region; thse 4 totals (ranging from 0 to 16) are then multipled by the standardized percentage of total body area that region represents (head=0.1 of body surface area, trunk=0.2 of body surface area, arms=0.3 of body surface area, and legs=0.4 of body surface area). PASI-90 and PASI-75 response were defined at >=90% and >=75% improvement in overall PASI score when compared to baselne, respectively.
measure.population: The population consisted of participants who were in the efficacy population of the treatment phase and who entered into the extended treatment phase and had a PASI-75 response at Week 50 with at least one PASI evaluation during the extended treatment phase.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Mean Dermatology Life Quality Index (DLQI)
outcome.description: The DLQI assesses the impact of psoriasis on the participants's daily life. DLQI total score comprises 6 different aspects that may affect quality of life: symptoms and feelings, daily activities, leisure, work or school performance, personal relationships, and treatment. DLQI total scores range from 0 to 30, with 0 corresponding to the best quality of life and 30 to the worst with 0-1=no effect on the partipant's life, 2-5=small effect on the participant's life, 6-10= moderate effect on the participant's life, 11=20= very large effect on participant's life, and 21-30 = extremely large effect on participant's life.
outcome.population: The population consisted of all participants with a DLQI measurement at baseline and at each time point.

group.title: Infliximab 5 mg/kg
group.description: Infliximab administered intravenously at a dose of 5 mg/kg of body weight at Weeks 0, 2, 6, and then every 8 weeks (Week 14, 22, 30, 38, and 46 for the Treatment Period and Weeks 54, 62, 70, 78, 86, and 94 for the Extended Treatment Period) as per the product monograph (PM; Canada, summary of product characteristics (SPC; European Union), or local labelling (for all other countries).

DLQI total scores range from 0 to 30, with 0 corresponding to the best quality of life and 30 to the worst with 0-1=no effect on the partipant's life, 2-5=small effect on the participant's life, 6-10= moderate effect on the participant's life, 11=20= very large effect on participant's life, and 21-30 = extremely large effect on participant's life.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With a PASI-50, PASI-75, PASI-90, or PASI-100 Response at Week 98
outcome.description: Using a scale of 0=none to 4= very severe, each body region (head, trunk, arms, and legs) is rated for redness, thickness and scaling of the largest psoriatic area in that region; these 4 totals (ranging from 0 to 16) are then multiplied by the standardized percentage of total body area that each region represents (head = 0.1 of body surface area, trunk = 0.2 of body surface area, arms=0.3 of the body surface area, and legs = 0.4 of body surface area). An assessment is then made of the percentage of the area in that body region that is involved by the psoriatic lesions; this is expressed by a score from 0 (0% involved) to 6 (100% involved) and this score is multiplied by the subtotal of the total body area of that region; the four region scores are then added to produce the total PASI score. PASI-50, PASI-75, PASI-90, and PASI-100 response were defined as >=25%, >=50%, >=75%, >=90%, =100% improvement in PASI score versus baseline, respectively.
outcome.population: The population consisted of participants who were in the efficacy population of the treatment phase and who entered into the extended treatment phase with at least one PASI evaluation during the extended treatment phase.

group.title: Infliximab 5 mg/kg
group.description: Infliximab administered intravenously at a dose of 5 mg/kg of body weight at Weeks 0, 2, 6, and then every 8 weeks (Week 14, 22, 30, 38, and 46 for the Treatment Period and Weeks 54, 62, 70, 78, 86, and 94 for the Extended Treatment Period) as per the product monograph (PM; Canada, summary of product characteristics (SPC; European Union), or local labelling (for all other countries).

measure.title: Number of Participants With a PASI-50, PASI-75, PASI-90, or PASI-100 Response at Week 98
measure.description: Using a scale of 0=none to 4= very severe, each body region (head, trunk, arms, and legs) is rated for redness, thickness and scaling of the largest psoriatic area in that region; these 4 totals (ranging from 0 to 16) are then multiplied by the standardized percentage of total body area that each region represents (head = 0.1 of body surface area, trunk = 0.2 of body surface area, arms=0.3 of the body surface area, and legs = 0.4 of body surface area). measure.population: The population consisted of participants who were in the efficacy population of the treatment phase and who entered into the extended treatment phase with at least one PASI evaluation during the extended treatment phase.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Achieved a PASI-75 Response at Week 50 by Age
outcome.description: Participant PASI scores were used to measure the severity and extent of psoriasis. Using a scale of 0=none to 4= very severe, each body region (head, trunk, arms, and legs) is rated for redness, thickness and scaling of the largest psoriatic area in that region; these 4 totals (totals ranging from 0 to 16) are then multiplied by the standardized percentage of total body area that each region represents (head = 0.1 of body surface area, trunk = 0.2 of body surface area, arms=0.3 of the body surface area, and legs = 0.4 of body surface area). An assessment is then made of the percentage of the area in that body region that is involved by the psoriatic lesions; this is expressed by a score from 0 (0% involved) to 6 (100% involved) and this score is multiplied by the subtotal of the total body area of that region; the four region scores are then added to produce the total PASI score. PASI-75 response was defined as >=75% improvement in overall PASI score when compared to baseline.
outcome.population: The Efficacy Population includes all participants with a baseline PASI score within 14 days of the time of the first infusion and at least one post-baseline PASI score.

measure.population: The Efficacy Population includes all participants with a baseline PASI score within 14 days of the time of the first infusion and at least one post-baseline PASI score.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Achieved a PASI-75 Response at Week 50 by PASI Score at Baseline
outcome.description: Participant PASI scores were used to measure the severity and extent of psoriasis. Using a scale of 0=none to 4= very severe, each body region (head, trunk, arms, and legs) is rated for redness, thickness and scaling of the largest psoriatic area in that region; these 4 totals (totals ranging from 0 to 16) are then multiplied by the standardized percentage of total body area that each region represents (head = 0.1 of body surface area, trunk = 0.2 of body surface area, arms=0.3 of the body surface area, and legs = 0.4 of body surface area). An assessment is then made of the percentage of the area in that body region that is involved by the psoriatic lesions; this is expressed by a score from 0 (0% involved) to 6 (100% involved) and this score is multiplied by the subtotal of the total body area of that region; the four region scores are then added to produce the total PASI score. PASI-75 response was defined as >=75% improvement in overall PASI score when compared to baseline..
outcome.population: The Efficacy Population includes all participants with a baseline PASI score within 14 days of the time of the first infusion and at least one post-baseline PASI score.

group.title: Infliximab 5 mg/kg
group.description: Infliximab administered intravenously at a dose of 5 mg/kg body weight at Weeks 0, 2, 6 and then every 8 weeks (Weeks 14, 22, 30, 38, and 46 for the Treatment Period and Week 54, 62, 70, 78, 86, and 94 for the Extended Treatment Period) as per the product monograph (PM; Canada), summary of product characteristics (SPC; European Union), or local labeling (for all other countries).

measure.title: Number of Participants Who Achieved a PASI-75 Response at Week 50 by PASI Score at Baseline
measure.description: Participant PASI scores were used to measure the severity and extent of psoriasis. Using a scale of 0=none to 4= very severe, each body region (head, trunk, arms, and legs) is rated for redness, thickness and scaling of the largest psoriatic area in that region; these 4 totals (totals ranging from 0 to 16) are then multiplied by the standardized percentage of total body area that each region represents (head = 0.1 of body surface area, trunk = 0.2 of body surface area, arms=0.3 of the body surface area, and legs = 0.4 of body surface area). An assessment is then made of the percentage of the area in that body region that is involved by the psoriatic lesions; this is expressed by a score from 0 (0% involved) to 6 (100% involved) and this score is multiplied by the subtotal of the total body area of that region; the four region scores are then added to produce the total PASI score. PASI-75 response was defined as >=75% improvement in overall PASI score when compared to baseline..
measure.population: The Efficacy Population includes all participants with a baseline PASI score within 14 days of the time of the first infusion and at least one post-baseline PASI score.

group.title: Infliximab 5 mg/kg
group.description: Infliximab administered intravenously at a dose of 5 mg/kg body weight at Weeks 0, 2, 6 and then every 8 weeks (Weeks 14, 22, 30, 38, and 46 for the Treatment Period and Week 54, 62, 70, 78, 86, and 94 for the Extended Treatment Period) as per the product monograph (PM; Canada), summary of product characteristics (SPC; European Union), or local labeling (for all other countries).

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The investigator agrees to provide the sponsor 45 days prior to submission for publication or presentation, review copies of abstracts or manuscripts for publication. The sponsor shall have the right to review and comment with respect to publications, abstracts, slides, and manuscripts and the right to review and comment on the data.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
